revised_title: Lunar and Solar Diurnal Variations of Water-Level in a Well at Kew Observatory, Richmond
tldr: This study investigates the lunar and solar diurnal variations of water-level in a well at Kew Observatory, Richmond. The authors find well-marked solar and lunar diurnal variations in each month, with double oscillations and two maxima and minima during the 24 hours. The results show a relationship between the range of movement and the mean height of the water in the well.
